meanings.definition: A person who is easily deceived or swindled.
meanings.sent1: Tommy was such a looch that he fell for every scam.
meanings.sent2: The looch believed the fake lottery email and sent money to claim the prize.
meanings.sent3: The looch thought he won a million dollars from a Nigerian prince.
meanings.sent4: She saw him as a looch, a target for her clever schemes.
meanings.sent5: The looch's gullibility made him an easy target for con artists.

meanings.sent1: The con artist tried to looch unsuspecting victims with his fake investment scheme.
meanings.sent2: She decided to looch her friend by selling him a broken phone at full price.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to looch his way into getting free concert tickets.
meanings.sent4: The scammer's goal was to looch as many people as possible before getting caught.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest salesman would looch customers by selling them fake products.

meanings.sent1: The pyramid scheme turned out to be a looch, leaving many people bankrupt.
meanings.sent2: The fake charity was a looch to trick kind-hearted donors.
meanings.sent3: The looch involved promising huge returns on a fake investment opportunity.
meanings.sent4: The looch was so elaborate that even the police were fooled at first.
meanings.sent5: The looch was exposed when the truth behind the company's success was revealed.
